title: Tomato Bisque Recipe
description: This tomato bisque uses canned tomatoes, vegetables, cream, and spices to make a smooth, rich bisque that tastes like it's right out of the garden.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Vegetable Soup Recipes Tomato Soup Recipes Tomato Bisque 4.9 (170) 138 Reviews 42 Photos This tomato bisque is proof you don't need a whole basket of vine-ripened tomatoes to make delicious tomato bisque. This recipe uses canned tomatoes. Rice makes this soup silky, not starchy. By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich — aka Chef John — has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes. He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on November 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 42 42 42 42 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 cup diced onion ½ cup diced celery 1 pinch salt 3 cloves garlic, chopped 1 (32 ounce) container chicken broth, or more as needed 1 (28 ounce) can crushed San Marzano tomatoes ½ teaspoon paprika 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, or to taste 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste 3 tablespoons uncooked jasmine rice 1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste ½ cup heavy whipping cream salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste 2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream, divided 2 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh basil leaves, divided Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat; cook and stir onion and celery with a pinch of salt until onion is translucent, 5 to 8 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour chicken broth and tomatoes into onion mixture. Bring to a simmer and season with paprika, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Turn heat to low and stir rice into soup; skim foam occasionally and simmer until rice and vegetables are very tender, 35 to 45 minutes. Add sugar. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Blend soup with an immersion blender in the pot until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk 1/2 cup cream into soup and season with salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and sugar if needed. If soup is too thick, add more broth; if soup is too thin, cook, stirring often, until reduced and slightly thickened, about 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Ladle into warmed bowls; garnish each bowl with a drizzle of cream and top each with about 1 teaspoon chopped basil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 344 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 198 Calories 12g Fat 20g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 198 % Daily Value * Total Fat 12g 16% Saturated Fat 6g 31% Cholesterol 38mg 13% Sodium 906mg 39% Total Carbohydrate 20g 7% Dietary Fiber 3g 12% Total Sugars 3g Protein 4g 9% Vitamin C 15mg 17% Calcium 76mg 6% Iron 2mg 11% Potassium 482mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Tomato Bisque 01 of 42 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 42 Photo by  BriskPlum7231 12/14/2022 so good! i have minimal experience in baking, and zero in cooking, but it turned out so tasty! The recipe was easy to follow as well, I'll make this again in the future 03 of 42 Photo by  Lacyanne 09/12/2022 Well this didn't last as long as I thought. I made this preparing to give some away and have dinner and lunch, however, it turned out far too tasty to make it to lunch. I served with an incredibly basic grilled cheese and received rave reviews from the husband. He ended up having two bowls and requested to have again soon. With fall weather on the horizon, I anticipate making this again and again. I used average crushed tomatoes but other than that followed the recipe exactly. I can't wait to compare to the fresh tomato soup. Thanks Chef John! 04 of 42 Photo by  sonal 10/30/2021 05 of 42 Photo by  Dan Toomey 05/07/2021 Perfect as is! My wife LOVED it. Thanks Chef John! 06 of 42 Photo by  Clint Ericson 02/06/2021 07 of 42 Photo by  Alex Hrovat 01/07/2021 08 of 42 Photo by  Kitty 01/02/2021 Amazing recipe, the rice works really well to add that creamy bisque-y texture. Bf and I made it twice, first w/ vegetable broth & then again w/ fake chicken broth (I'm vegetarian). Both were extremely delicious. I also added a carrot, which gave a nice flavor as well. The first time we made this we didn't have basil, so we topped w/ green onion & cheesy breadcrumbs. (I think chives would also be great) 09 of 42 Photo by  Marilyn Couch 10/21/2020 10 of 42 Photo by  Devi Mazyck Gomez 07/24/2020 I used this as a reference. Some ingredients I didn't have so I substituted or left out. I used avocado oil. Didn't have any rice, cream, celery. Used fresh tomatoes. Used almond milk. It still came out rich and smooth. For seasonings, I used thyme, oregano and chives. I sprinkled Parmesan cheese before serving. My kids loved it. Perfect compliment to grilled cheese sandwich. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Tomato Bisque on Steroids Better-Than-Grilled Cheese Tomato Soup 1 Rating Fresh Tomato Soup with Crispy Cheese Toast 27 Ratings Favorite Basil Tomato Soup 31 Ratings Classic Dairy-Free Cream of Tomato and Basil Soup 14 Ratings Creamy Tomato Soup (No Cream) 38 Ratings Instant Pot® Easy Vegan Tomato and Basil Soup Tuscan Tomato Soup (Pappa al Pomodoro) 1 Rating Spicy Fresh Tomato Soup 4 Ratings Chunky Butternut Squash and Tomato Soup 11 Ratings Fresh Tomato and Pepper Bisque Creamy Tomato Artichoke Soup 11 Ratings Red Pepper and Tomato Soup 8 Ratings Spicy Tomato Soup 11 Ratings Afghan Tomato Soup (Aush Goshti) 16 Ratings Easy Tomato-Beet Soup 8 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
